strapiPost.title: Fayetteville Allocates $1.5M in ARPA Funds To Help With Rising Childcare Costs
strapiPost.content:
Fayetteville is addressing the rising childcare costs by expanding its childhood assistance program with $1.5 million in ARPA funds dedicated to providing eligible recipients with up to 12 monthly payments for childcare.

  • Investing in care: The city's support for the industry is crucial to alleviating the high demand for childcare and hard-to-come-by staffing, often resulting in families being waitlisted for months.
  • Consider the cost: Childcare is often one of the most significant monthly expenses for families, impacting low-income families or those with multiple kids in childcare the most.
